title: DubemIfedigbo001
author: DubemIfedigbo001
content: After joining the forum earlier this month, I faced a lot of difficulties with proper involvement in the forum activities. I did not know how to:PostReply postPaste linksEmbed imagesIn a nutshell I spent days trying to figure out how to actually engage, although I read a lot of pinned messages (based on advice I got earlier) and knew what I should do, put doing it properly was a herculean task. I had to seek help from a friend and all he showed me was how to reply posts and he too briefed me that he faced a lot of challenges before finding out how to reply posts by intuition. I knew there would be an assistant somewhere and started searching for it myself. Little did I know that the pre-requisites help I've been looking for was clearly spelt out in the help navigation, All thanks to the forum moderators that provided such a wonderful guide for us. I've consumed that content repeatedly and wouldn't fail to fall back to it in event of further difficulties. It is possible that some newbies like me had given up when faced with these simple challenges trying to engage. Subsequently, I advice all freshers to access the help navigation.It assisted me in a great way and you'll be glad you visited it as it properly explains the forum involvement architecture.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: The forum never intended any thing to be difficult that's while the help button is clearly put on the tools bar, if you able to register, and login and been experiencing any difficult you would not find it so difficult to see the help button too, I always advice newbies to explore more on the forum, it's best to unlearn what you have heard about the forum when you get in here and strive to learn new things and the best way to do that is not shying away from exploration.About pasting links, it's one thing to know how to learn it and it's another thing to know how not to miss use it, just like some do abuse the quote option and then creating an unnecessary eye saw of quote pyramid. Don't paste link that's miss leading, spam, phishing link, or something that actually against the forum rules.

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: To what I know, no body gets to know so much about the forum and uses of certain features in just a snap of finger. You need to give yourself more and more time as you engage in activities and discussions within the forum you acquaint yourself gradually with everything you need to know. For some reasons you have been able to discover the Help button around the toolbar, in same vein you will discover more other helpful resource to help you navigate your way around the forum.There's a possibility you might wanna pull up another post  seeking for answers to a few things you're yet to know about the forum which is possible that other newbies like you must have asked same, so as a way not to reiterate same questions looking like spamming do well to navigate around each section of the forum like a way of DYOR and you can start by going through post's in Beginners and Help  board it's like a gateway for all newbies in the community. Here's some tips from a fellow member:FAQ: Everything you need to know about forum 'activity, account ranks and merithttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2766177.msg28250551#msg28250551

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: I suppose that newbies can have difficulties finding a forum only if they have never used this way of communicating with people, namely, if they do not understand what forums are. This forum is equivalent; like others, it does not differ much from each other. Yes, the topic of the forum is different, and the rules are slightly different, but one thing is important in all forums: communication and discussion of any topic. What can be difficult, I do not understand. Just read and communicate; do not burden yourself with problems because you may be different from other members of the forum somewhere. We are all different. On the contrary, if a person pretends to be knowledgeable at a time when he is not, he will once again attract attention to himself, and only after that may there be an understanding that the forum is aggressive towards newbies.The best thing that should be in the user who came to this forum is his sincerity and interest in Bitcoin.

comments.author: rby
comments.body: Quote from: DubemIfedigbo001 on May 22, 2023, 04:25:01 AMAfter joining the forum earlier this month, I faced a lot of difficulties with proper involvement in the forum activities. I did not know how to:PostReply postThis shouldn't be a problem to any newbie in the forum, unless the person has never had access to internet before, perhaps not being in any forum before. Every post has a reply icon and a text box for messages which shows preview and submit. Very simple. If you want to start a new topic, at the top of every board is New Topic icon.QuotePaste linksThis also is the simplest thing anyone can do. I mean there is no tutorials in copying and pasting a link.QuoteEmbed imagesThis could be the only place a little guidance is need because a third party app is needed to upload images in the forum. One simple method newbies don't use is to quote an already well formated post of a senior member and reveal the structure they used, then learn from it.Note: You can make posts without using artificial colours, to much coloration will make people pay less attention to your post.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: I will welcome you at first because you are still new here and I will tell you just little information about this platform. As a newbie, you can post daily but limited to do.You can not upload pictures unless you register a copper member account before you could be able to do any upload.You can take part in  altcoin promotion but in signature, you will have to wait  till you rank up depending on the terms and conditions each manager put up as a criteria for joining their campaign.For merits and new rank requirements, check here;https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2818350.msg28856522#msg28856522https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=237597.msg2513302#msg2513302No post of affiliate links here as it is highly prohibited
